00100 static void
00101 cleanup_at_exit(void)
00102 {
00103     if (unlink_this_at_exit != NULL) {
00104         unlink(unlink_this_at_exit);
00105         unlink_this_at_exit = NULL;
00106     }
00107 }
00108 
00109 static void
00110 handle_fatal_signal(int sig)
00111 {
00112     cleanup_at_exit();
00113     _exit(sig);
00114 }
00115 
00116 static void
00117 unlink_at_exit(const char *path)
00118 {
00119     if (unlink_this_at_exit == NULL) {
00120         static char namstor[sizeof(struct sockaddr_un)];
00121         strncpy(namstor, path, sizeof(namstor));
00122         unlink_this_at_exit = namstor;
00123         signal(SIGTERM, &handle_fatal_signal);
00124         signal(SIGINT, &handle_fatal_signal);
00125         signal(SIGHUP, &handle_fatal_signal);
00126         atexit(&cleanup_at_exit);
00127     }
00128 }
00129 
00130 static int
00131 comm_file_ok(void)
00132 {
00133     struct stat statbuf;
00134     int res;
00135     if (unlink_this_at_exit == NULL)
00136         return(1);
00137     res = stat(unlink_this_at_exit, &statbuf);
00138     if (res == -1)
00139         return(0);
00140     return(1);
00141 }

00143 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00144 charbuf_obtain(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00145 {
00146     struct ccn_charbuf *c = h->scratch_charbuf;
00147     if (c == NULL)
00148         return(ccn_charbuf_create());
00149     h->scratch_charbuf = NULL;
00150     c->length = 0;
00151     return(c);
00152 }
00153 
00154 static void
00155 charbuf_release(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_charbuf *c)
00156 {
00157     c->length = 0;
00158     if (h->scratch_charbuf == NULL)
00159         h->scratch_charbuf = c;
00160     else
00161         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00162 }

00185 /**
00186  * Looks up a face based on its faceid (private).
00187  */
00188 static struct face *
00189 face_from_faceid(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
00190 {
00191     unsigned slot = faceid & MAXFACES;
00192     struct face *face = NULL;
00193     if (slot < h->face_limit) {
00194         face = h->faces_by_faceid[slot];
00195         if (face != NULL && face->faceid != faceid)
00196             face = NULL;
00197     }
00198     return(face);
00199 }
00200 
00201 /**
00202  * Looks up a face based on its faceid.
00203  */
00204 struct face *
00205 ccnd_face_from_faceid(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
00206 {
00207     return(face_from_faceid(h, faceid));
00208 }

00210 /**
00211  * Assigns the faceid for a nacent face,
00212  * calls register_new_face() if successful.
00213  */
00214 static int
00215 enroll_face(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
00216 {
00217     unsigned i;
00218     unsigned n = h->face_limit;
00219     struct face **a = h->faces_by_faceid;
00220     for (i = h->face_rover; i < n; i++)
00221         if (a[i] == NULL) goto use_i;
00222     for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00223         if (a[i] == NULL) {
00224             /* bump gen only if second pass succeeds */
00225             h->face_gen += MAXFACES + 1;
00226             goto use_i;
00227         }
00228     i = (n + 1) * 3 / 2;
00229     if (i > MAXFACES) i = MAXFACES;
00230     if (i <= n)
00231         return(-1); /* overflow */
00232     a = realloc(a, i * sizeof(struct face *));
00233     if (a == NULL)
00234         return(-1); /* ENOMEM */
00235     h->face_limit = i;
00236     while (--i > n)
00237         a[i] = NULL;
00238     h->faces_by_faceid = a;
00239 use_i:
00240     a[i] = face;
00241     h->face_rover = i + 1;
00242     face->faceid = i | h->face_gen;
00243     register_new_face(h, face);
00244     return (face->faceid);
00245 }
00246 
00247 static int
00248 choose_face_delay(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, enum cq_delay_class c)
00249 {
00250     int shift = (c == CCN_CQ_SLOW) ? 2 : 0;
00251     if (c == CCN_CQ_ASAP)
00252         return(1);
00253     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LINK) != 0) /* udplink or such, delay more */
00254         return((h->data_pause_microsec) << shift);
00255     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LOCAL) != 0)
00256         return(5); /* local stream, answer quickly */
00257     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_MCAST) != 0)
00258         return((h->data_pause_microsec) << shift); /* multicast, delay more */
00259     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) != 0)
00260         return(100 << shift); /* localhost, delay just a little */
00261     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0)
00262         return(500 << shift); /* udp, delay just a little */
00263     return(100); /* probably tcp to a different machine */
00264 }
00265 
00266 static struct content_queue *
00267 content_queue_create(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, enum cq_delay_class c)
00268 {
00269     struct content_queue *q;
00270     unsigned usec;
00271     q = calloc(1, sizeof(*q));
00272     if (q != NULL) {
00273         usec = choose_face_delay(h, face, c);
00274         q->burst_nsec = (usec <= 500 ? 500 : 150000); // XXX - needs a knob
00275         q->min_usec = usec;
00276         q->rand_usec = 2 * usec;
00277         q->nrun = 0;
00278         q->send_queue = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00279         if (q->send_queue == NULL) {
00280             free(q);
00281             return(NULL);
00282         }
00283         q->sender = NULL;
00284     }
00285     return(q);
00286 }
00287 
00288 static void
00289 content_queue_destroy(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_queue **pq)
00290 {
00291     struct content_queue *q;
00292     if (*pq != NULL) {
00293         q = *pq;
00294         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&q->send_queue);
00295         if (q->sender != NULL) {
00296             ccn_schedule_cancel(h->sched, q->sender);
00297             q->sender = NULL;
00298         }
00299         free(q);
00300         *pq = NULL;
00301     }
00302 }

00304 /**
00305  * Close an open file descriptor quietly.
00306  */
00307 static void
00308 close_fd(int *pfd)
00309 {
00310     if (*pfd != -1) {
00311         close(*pfd);
00312         *pfd = -1;
00313     }
00314 }
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * Close an open file descriptor, and grumble about it.
00318  */
00319 static void
00320 ccnd_close_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid, int *pfd)
00321 {
00322     int res;
00323     
00324     if (*pfd != -1) {
00325         int linger = 0;
00326         setsockopt(*pfd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER,
00327                    &linger, sizeof(linger));
00328         res = close(*pfd);
00329         if (res == -1)
00330             ccnd_msg(h, "close failed for face %u fd=%d: %s (errno=%d)",
00331                      faceid, *pfd, strerror(errno), errno);
00332         else
00333             ccnd_msg(h, "closing fd %d while finalizing face %u", *pfd, faceid);
00334         *pfd = -1;
00335     }
00336 }
00337 
00338 static void
00339 finalize_face(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00340 {
00341     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
00342     struct face *face = e->data;
00343     unsigned i = face->faceid & MAXFACES;
00344     enum cq_delay_class c;
00345     int recycle = 0;
00346     
00347     if (i < h->face_limit && h->faces_by_faceid[i] == face) {
00348         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) == 0)
00349             ccnd_face_status_change(h, face->faceid);
00350         if (e->ht == h->faces_by_fd)
00351             ccnd_close_fd(h, face->faceid, &face->recv_fd);
00352         h->faces_by_faceid[i] = NULL;
00353         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED) != 0 &&
00354               face->faceid == ((h->face_rover - 1) | h->face_gen)) {
00355             /* stream connection with no ccn traffic - safe to reuse */
00356             recycle = 1;
00357             h->face_rover--;
00358         }
00359         for (c = 0; c < CCN_CQ_N; c++)
00360             content_queue_destroy(h, &(face->q[c]));
00361         ccnd_msg(h, "%s face id %u (slot %u)",
00362             recycle ? "recycling" : "releasing",
00363             face->faceid, face->faceid & MAXFACES);
00364         /* Don't free face->addr; storage is managed by hash table */
00365     }
00366     else if (face->faceid != CCN_NOFACEID)
00367         ccnd_msg(h, "orphaned face %u", face->faceid);
00368     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->inbuf);
00369     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
00370 }
00371 
00372 static struct content_entry *
00373 content_from_accession(struct ccnd_handle *h, ccn_accession_t accession)
00374 {
00375     struct content_entry *ans = NULL;
00376     if (accession < h->accession_base) {
00377         struct sparse_straggler_entry *entry;
00378         entry = hashtb_lookup(h->sparse_straggler_tab,
00379                               &accession, sizeof(accession));
00380         if (entry != NULL)
00381             ans = entry->content;
00382     }
00383     else if (accession < h->accession_base + h->content_by_accession_window) {
00384         ans = h->content_by_accession[accession - h->accession_base];
00385         if (ans != NULL && ans->accession != accession)
00386             ans = NULL;
00387     }
00388     return(ans);
00389 }
00390 
00391 static void
00392 cleanout_stragglers(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00393 {
00394     ccn_accession_t accession;
00395     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00396     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00397     struct sparse_straggler_entry *entry = NULL;
00398     struct content_entry **a = h->content_by_accession;
00399     unsigned n_direct;
00400     unsigned n_occupied;
00401     unsigned window;
00402     unsigned i;
00403     if (h->accession <= h->accession_base || a[0] == NULL)
00404         return;
00405     n_direct = h->accession - h->accession_base;
00406     if (n_direct < 1000)
00407         return;
00408     n_occupied = hashtb_n(h->content_tab) - hashtb_n(h->sparse_straggler_tab);
00409     if (n_occupied >= (n_direct / 8))
00410         return;
00411     /* The direct lookup table is too sparse, so sweep stragglers */
00412     hashtb_start(h->sparse_straggler_tab, e);
00413     window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00414     for (i = 0; i < window; i++) {
00415         if (a[i] != NULL) {
00416             if (n_occupied >= ((window - i) / 8))
00417                 break;
00418             accession = h->accession_base + i;
00419             hashtb_seek(e, &accession, sizeof(accession), 0);
00420             entry = e->data;
00421             if (entry != NULL && entry->content == NULL) {
00422                 entry->content = a[i];
00423                 a[i] = NULL;
00424                 n_occupied -= 1;
00425             }
00426         }
00427     }
00428     hashtb_end(e);
00429 }
00430 
00431 static int
00432 cleanout_empties(struct ccnd_handle *h)
00433 {
00434     unsigned i = 0;
00435     unsigned j = 0;
00436     struct content_entry **a = h->content_by_accession;
00437     unsigned window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00438     if (a == NULL)
00439         return(-1);
00440     cleanout_stragglers(h);
00441     while (i < window && a[i] == NULL)
00442         i++;
00443     if (i == 0)
00444         return(-1);
00445     h->accession_base += i;
00446     while (i < window)
00447         a[j++] = a[i++];
00448     while (j < window)
00449         a[j++] = NULL;
00450     return(0);
00451 }
00452 
00453 static void
00454 enroll_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00455 {
00456     unsigned new_window;
00457     struct content_entry **new_array;
00458     struct content_entry **old_array;
00459     unsigned i = 0;
00460     unsigned j = 0;
00461     unsigned window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00462     if ((content->accession - h->accession_base) >= window &&
00463           cleanout_empties(h) < 0) {
00464         if (content->accession < h->accession_base)
00465             return;
00466         window = h->content_by_accession_window;
00467         old_array = h->content_by_accession;
00468         new_window = ((window + 20) * 3 / 2);
00469         if (new_window < window)
00470             return;
00471         new_array = calloc(new_window, sizeof(new_array[0]));
00472         if (new_array == NULL)
00473             return;
00474         while (i < h->content_by_accession_window && old_array[i] == NULL)
00475             i++;
00476         h->accession_base += i;
00477         h->content_by_accession = new_array;
00478         while (i < h->content_by_accession_window)
00479             new_array[j++] = old_array[i++];
00480         h->content_by_accession_window = new_window;
00481     free(old_array);
00482     }
00483     h->content_by_accession[content->accession - h->accession_base] = content;
00484 }
00485 
00486 static void
00487 finalize_content(struct hashtb_enumerator *content_enumerator)
00488 {
00489     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(content_enumerator->ht, NULL);
00490     struct content_entry *entry = content_enumerator->data;
00491     unsigned i = entry->accession - h->accession_base;
00492     if (i < h->content_by_accession_window &&
00493           h->content_by_accession[i] == entry) {
00494         content_skiplist_remove(h, entry);
00495         h->content_by_accession[i] = NULL;
00496     }
00497     else {
00498         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00499         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00500         hashtb_start(h->sparse_straggler_tab, e);
00501         if (hashtb_seek(e, &entry->accession, sizeof(entry->accession), 0) ==
00502               HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
00503             ccnd_msg(h, "orphaned content %llu",
00504                      (unsigned long long)(entry->accession));
00505             hashtb_delete(e);
00506             hashtb_end(e);
00507             return;
00508         }
00509         content_skiplist_remove(h, entry);
00510         hashtb_delete(e);
00511         hashtb_end(e);
00512     }
00513     if (entry->comps != NULL) {
00514         free(entry->comps);
00515         entry->comps = NULL;
00516     }
00517 }
00518 
00519 static int
00520 content_skiplist_findbefore(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00521                             const unsigned char *key,
00522                             size_t keysize,
00523                             struct content_entry *wanted_old,
00524                             struct ccn_indexbuf **ans)
00525 {
00526     int i;
00527     int n = h->skiplinks->n;
00528     struct ccn_indexbuf *c;
00529     struct content_entry *content;
00530     int order;
00531     size_t start;
00532     size_t end;
00533     
00534     c = h->skiplinks;
00535     for (i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00536         for (;;) {
00537             if (c->buf[i] == 0)
00538                 break;
00539             content = content_from_accession(h, c->buf[i]);
00540             if (content == NULL)
00541                 abort();
00542             start = content->comps[0];
00543             end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00544             order = ccn_compare_names(content->key + start - 1, end - start + 2,
00545                                       key, keysize);
00546             if (order > 0)
00547                 break;
00548             if (order == 0 && (wanted_old == content || wanted_old == NULL))
00549                 break;
00550             if (content->skiplinks == NULL || i >= content->skiplinks->n)
00551                 abort();
00552             c = content->skiplinks;
00553         }
00554         ans[i] = c;
00555     }
00556     return(n);
00557 }
00558 
00559 #define CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH 30
00560 static void
00561 content_skiplist_insert(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00562 {
00563     int d;
00564     int i;
00565     size_t start;
00566     size_t end;
00567     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00568     if (content->skiplinks != NULL) abort();
00569     for (d = 1; d < CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH - 1; d++)
00570         if ((nrand48(h->seed) & 3) != 0) break;
00571     while (h->skiplinks->n < d)
00572         ccn_indexbuf_append_element(h->skiplinks, 0);
00573     start = content->comps[0];
00574     end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00575     i = content_skiplist_findbefore(h,
00576                                     content->key + start - 1,
00577                                     end - start + 2, NULL, pred);
00578     if (i < d)
00579         d = i; /* just in case */
00580     content->skiplinks = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00581     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00582         ccn_indexbuf_append_element(content->skiplinks, pred[i]->buf[i]);
00583         pred[i]->buf[i] = content->accession;
00584     }
00585 }
00586 
00587 static void
00588 content_skiplist_remove(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00589 {
00590     int i;
00591     int d;
00592     size_t start;
00593     size_t end;
00594     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00595     if (content->skiplinks == NULL) abort();
00596     start = content->comps[0];
00597     end = content->comps[content->ncomps - 1];
00598     d = content_skiplist_findbefore(h,
00599                                     content->key + start - 1,
00600                                     end - start + 2, content, pred);
00601     if (d > content->skiplinks->n)
00602         d = content->skiplinks->n;
00603     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00604         pred[i]->buf[i] = content->skiplinks->buf[i];
00605     }
00606     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&content->skiplinks);
00607 }
00608 
00609 static struct content_entry *
00610 find_first_match_candidate(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00611                            const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00612                            const struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi)
00613 {
00614     int res;
00615     struct ccn_indexbuf *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00616     size_t start = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Name];
00617     size_t end = pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Name];
00618     struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf = NULL;
00619     if (pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] < pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude]) {
00620         /* Check for <Exclude><Any/><Component>... fast case */
00621         struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00622         struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
00623         size_t ex1start;
00624         size_t ex1end;
00625         d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder,
00626                                   interest_msg + pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude],
00627                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude] -
00628                                   pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude]);
00629         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00630         if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00631             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00632             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00633             if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
00634                 ex1start = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00635                 ccn_buf_advance_past_element(d);
00636                 ex1end = pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] + d->decoder.token_index;
00637                 if (d->decoder.state >= 0) {
00638                     namebuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00639                     ccn_charbuf_append(namebuf,
00640                                        interest_msg + start,
00641                                        end - start);
00642                     namebuf->length--;
00643                     ccn_charbuf_append(namebuf,
00644                                        interest_msg + ex1start,
00645                                        ex1end - ex1start);
00646                     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(namebuf);
00647                     if (h->debug & 8)
00648                         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "fastex", NULL,
00649                                         namebuf->buf, namebuf->length);
00650                 }
00651             }
00652         }
00653     }
00654     if (namebuf == NULL) {
00655         res = content_skiplist_findbefore(h, interest_msg + start, end - start,
00656                                           NULL, pred);
00657     }
00658     else {
00659         res = content_skiplist_findbefore(h, namebuf->buf, namebuf->length,
00660                                           NULL, pred);
00661         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namebuf);
00662     }
00663     if (res == 0)
00664         return(NULL);
00665     return(content_from_accession(h, pred[0]->buf[0]));
00666 }
00667 
00668 static int
00669 content_matches_interest_prefix(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00670                                 struct content_entry *content,
00671                                 const unsigned char *interest_msg,
00672                                 struct ccn_indexbuf *comps,
00673                                 int prefix_comps)
00674 {
00675     size_t prefixlen;
00676     if (prefix_comps < 0 || prefix_comps >= comps->n)
00677         abort();
00678     /* First verify the prefix match. */
00679     if (content->ncomps < prefix_comps + 1)
00680             return(0);
00681     prefixlen = comps->buf[prefix_comps] - comps->buf[0];
00682     if (content->comps[prefix_comps] - content->comps[0] != prefixlen)
00683         return(0);
00684     if (0 != memcmp(content->key + content->comps[0],
00685                     interest_msg + comps->buf[0],
00686                     prefixlen))
00687         return(0);
00688     return(1);
00689 }
00690 
00691 static ccn_accession_t
00692 content_skiplist_next(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
00693 {
00694     if (content == NULL)
00695         return(0);
00696     if (content->skiplinks == NULL || content->skiplinks->n < 1)
00697         return(0);
00698     return(content->skiplinks->buf[0]);
00699 }
00700 
00701 static void
00702 consume(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct propagating_entry *pe)
00703 {
00704     struct face *face = NULL;
00705     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&pe->outbound);
00706     if (pe->interest_msg != NULL) {
00707         free(pe->interest_msg);
00708         pe->interest_msg = NULL;
00709         face = face_from_faceid(h, pe->faceid);
00710         if (face != NULL)
00711             face->pending_interests -= 1;
00712     }
00713     if (pe->next != NULL) {
00714         pe->next->prev = pe->prev;
00715         pe->prev->next = pe->next;
00716         pe->next = pe->prev = NULL;
00717     }
00718     pe->usec = 0;
00719 }
00720 
00721 static void
00722 finalize_nameprefix(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00723 {
00724     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
00725     struct nameprefix_entry *npe = e->data;
00726     struct propagating_entry *head = &npe->pe_head;
00727     if (head->next != NULL) {
00728         while (head->next != head)
00729             consume(h, head->next);
00730     }
00731     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&npe->forward_to);
00732     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&npe->tap);
00733     while (npe->forwarding != NULL) {
00734         struct ccn_forwarding *f = npe->forwarding;
00735         npe->forwarding = f->next;
00736         free(f);
00737     }
00738 }
00739 
00740 static void
00741 link_propagating_interest_to_nameprefix(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00742     struct propagating_entry *pe, struct nameprefix_entry *npe)
00743 {
00744     struct propagating_entry *head = &npe->pe_head;
00745     pe->next = head;
00746     pe->prev = head->prev;
00747     pe->prev->next = pe->next->prev = pe;
00748 }
00749 
00750 static void
00751 finalize_propagating(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00752 {
00753     struct ccnd_handle *h = hashtb_get_param(e->ht, NULL);
00754     consume(h, e->data);
00755 }
00756 
00757 static int
00758 create_local_listener(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *sockname, int backlog)
00759 {
00760     int res;
00761     int savedmask;
00762     int sock;
00763     struct sockaddr_un a = { 0 };
00764     res = unlink(sockname);
00765     if (res == 0) {
00766         ccnd_msg(NULL, "unlinked old %s, please wait", sockname);
00767         sleep(9); /* give old ccnd a chance to exit */
00768     }
00769     if (!(res == 0 || errno == ENOENT))
00770         ccnd_msg(NULL, "failed to unlink %s", sockname);
00771     a.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00772     strncpy(a.sun_path, sockname, sizeof(a.sun_path));
00773     sock = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00774     if (sock == -1)
00775         return(sock);
00776     savedmask = umask(0111); /* socket should be R/W by anybody */
00777     res = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&a, sizeof(a));
00778     umask(savedmask);
00779     if (res == -1) {
00780         close(sock);
00781         return(-1);
00782     }
00783     unlink_at_exit(sockname);
00784     res = listen(sock, backlog);
00785     if (res == -1) {
00786         close(sock);
00787         return(-1);
00788     }
00789     record_connection(h, sock, (struct sockaddr *)&a, sizeof(a),
00790                       (CCN_FACE_LOCAL | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE));
00791     return(sock);
00792 }
00793 
00794 static int
00795 establish_min_recv_bufsize(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd, int minsize)
00796 {
00797     int res;
00798     int rcvbuf;
00799     socklen_t rcvbuf_sz;
00800 
00801     rcvbuf_sz = sizeof(rcvbuf);
00802     res = getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, &rcvbuf_sz);
00803     if (res == -1)
00804         return (res);
00805     if (rcvbuf < minsize) {
00806         rcvbuf = minsize;
00807         res = setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &rcvbuf, sizeof(rcvbuf));
00808         if (res == -1)
00809             return(res);
00810     }
00811     ccnd_msg(h, "SO_RCVBUF for fd %d is %d", fd, rcvbuf);
00812     return(rcvbuf);
00813 }
00814 
00815 /**
00816  * Initialize the face flags based upon the addr information
00817  * and the provided explicit setflags.
00818  */
00819 static void
00820 init_face_flags(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, int setflags)
00821 {
00822     const struct sockaddr *addr = face->addr;
00823     const unsigned char *rawaddr = NULL;
00824     
00825     if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
00826         const struct sockaddr_in6 *addr6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)addr;
00827         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_INET6;
00828 #ifdef IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK
00829         if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LOOPBACK(&addr6->sin6_addr))
00830             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK;
00831 #endif
00832     }
00833     else if (addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
00834         const struct sockaddr_in *addr4 = (struct sockaddr_in *)addr;
00835         rawaddr = (const unsigned char *)&addr4->sin_addr.s_addr;
00836         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_INET;
00837         if (rawaddr[0] == 127)
00838             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK;
00839     }
00840     else if (addr->sa_family == AF_UNIX)
00841         face->flags |= (CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LOCAL);
00842     face->flags |= setflags;
00843 }
00844 
00845 /**
00846  * Make a new face entered in the faces_by_fd table.
00847  */
00848 static struct face *
00849 record_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd,
00850                   struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen,
00851                   int setflags)
00852 {
00853     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00854     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00855     int res;
00856     struct face *face = NULL;
00857     unsigned char *addrspace;
00858     
00859     res = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00860     if (res == -1)
00861         ccnd_msg(h, "fcntl: %s", strerror(errno));
00862     hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e);
00863     if (hashtb_seek(e, &fd, sizeof(fd), wholen) == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
00864         face = e->data;
00865         face->recv_fd = fd;
00866         face->sendface = CCN_NOFACEID;
00867         face->addrlen = e->extsize;
00868         addrspace = ((unsigned char *)e->key) + e->keysize;
00869         face->addr = (struct sockaddr *)addrspace;
00870         memcpy(addrspace, who, e->extsize);
00871         init_face_flags(h, face, setflags);
00872         res = enroll_face(h, face);
00873         if (res == -1) {
00874             hashtb_delete(e);
00875             face = NULL;
00876         }
00877     }
00878     hashtb_end(e);
00879     return(face);
00880 }
00881 
00882 /**
00883  * Accept an incoming DGRAM_STREAM connection, creating a new face.
00884  * @returns fd of new socket, or -1 for an error.
00885  */
00886 static int
00887 accept_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h, int listener_fd)
00888 {
00889     struct sockaddr_storage who;
00890     socklen_t wholen = sizeof(who);
00891     int fd;
00892     struct face *face;
00893 
00894     fd = accept(listener_fd, (struct sockaddr *)&who, &wholen);
00895     if (fd == -1) {
00896         ccnd_msg(h, "accept: %s", strerror(errno));
00897         return(-1);
00898     }
00899     face = record_connection(h, fd,
00900                             (struct sockaddr *)&who, wholen,
00901                             CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED);
00902     if (face == NULL)
00903         close_fd(&fd);
00904     else
00905         ccnd_msg(h, "accepted client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
00906     return(fd);
00907 }
00908 
00909 /**
00910  * Make an outbound stream connection.
00911  */
00912 static struct face *
00913 make_connection(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00914                 struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen,
00915                 int setflags)
00916 {
00917     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00918     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00919     int fd;
00920     int res;
00921     struct face *face;
00922     const int checkflags = CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_LOCAL |
00923                            CCN_FACE_NOSEND | CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED;
00924     const int wantflags = 0;
00925     
00926     /* Check for an existing usable connection */
00927     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00928         face = e->data;
00929         if (face->addr != NULL && face->addrlen == wholen &&
00930             ((face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) &&
00931             0 == memcmp(face->addr, who, wholen)) {
00932             hashtb_end(e);
00933             return(face);
00934         }
00935     }
00936     face = NULL;
00937     hashtb_end(e);
00938     /* No existing connection, try to make a new one. */
00939     fd = socket(who->sa_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00940     if (fd == -1) {
00941         ccnd_msg(h, "socket: %s", strerror(errno));
00942         return(NULL);
00943     }
00944     res = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00945     if (res == -1)
00946         ccnd_msg(h, "connect fcntl: %s", strerror(errno));
00947     setflags &= ~CCN_FACE_CONNECTING;
00948     res = connect(fd, who, wholen);
00949     if (res == -1 && errno == EINPROGRESS) {
00950         res = 0;
00951         setflags |= CCN_FACE_CONNECTING;
00952     }
00953     if (res == -1) {
00954         ccnd_msg(h, "connect failed: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
00955         close(fd);
00956         return(NULL);
00957     }
00958     face = record_connection(h, fd, who, wholen, setflags);
00959     if (face == NULL) {
00960         close(fd);
00961         return(NULL);
00962     }
00963     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_CONNECTING) != 0) {
00964         ccnd_msg(h, "connecting to client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
00965         face->outbufindex = 0;
00966         face->outbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00967     }
00968     else
00969         ccnd_msg(h, "connected client fd=%d id=%u", fd, face->faceid);
00970     return(face);
00971 }
00972 
00973 static int
00974 ccnd_getboundsocket(void *dat, struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen)
00975 {
00976     struct ccnd_handle *h = dat;
00977     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00978     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00979     int yes = 1;
00980     int res;
00981     int ans = -1;
00982     int wantflags = (CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE);
00983     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00984         struct face *face = e->data;
00985         if ((face->flags & wantflags) == wantflags &&
00986               wholen == face->addrlen &&
00987               0 == memcmp(who, face->addr, wholen)) {
00988             ans = face->recv_fd;
00989             break;
00990         }
00991     }
00992     hashtb_end(e);
00993     if (ans != -1)
00994         return(ans);
00995     ans = socket(who->sa_family, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
00996     if (ans == -1)
00997         return(ans);
00998     setsockopt(ans, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof(yes));
00999     res = bind(ans, who, wholen);
01000     if (res == -1) {
01001         ccnd_msg(h, "bind failed: %s (errno = %d)", strerror(errno), errno);
01002         close(ans);
01003         return(-1);
01004     }
01005     record_connection(h, ans, who, wholen,
01006                       CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE | CCN_FACE_NORECV);
01007     return(ans);
01008 }
01009 
01010 static unsigned
01011 faceid_from_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
01012 {
01013     struct face *face = hashtb_lookup(h->faces_by_fd, &fd, sizeof(fd));
01014     if (face != NULL)
01015         return(face->faceid);
01016     return(CCN_NOFACEID);
01017 }
01018 
01019 typedef void (*loggerproc)(void *, const char *, ...);
01020 static struct face *
01021 setup_multicast(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccn_face_instance *face_instance,
01022                 struct sockaddr *who, socklen_t wholen)
01023 {
01024     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01025     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01026     struct ccn_sockets socks = { -1, -1 };
01027     int res;
01028     struct face *face = NULL;
01029     const int checkflags = CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST |
01030                            CCN_FACE_LOCAL | CCN_FACE_NOSEND;
01031     const int wantflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST;
01032 
01033     /* See if one is already active */
01034     // XXX - should also compare and record additional mcast props.
01035     for (hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01036         face = e->data;
01037         if (face->addr != NULL && face->addrlen == wholen &&
01038             ((face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) &&
01039             0 == memcmp(face->addr, who, wholen)) {
01040             hashtb_end(e);
01041             return(face);
01042         }
01043     }
01044     face = NULL;
01045     hashtb_end(e);
01046     
01047     res = ccn_setup_socket(&face_instance->descr,
01048                            (loggerproc)&ccnd_msg, (void *)h,
01049                            &ccnd_getboundsocket, (void *)h,
01050                            &socks);
01051     if (res < 0)
01052         return(NULL);
01053     establish_min_recv_bufsize(h, socks.recving, 128*1024);
01054     face = record_connection(h, socks.recving, who, wholen,
01055                              (CCN_FACE_MCAST | CCN_FACE_DGRAM));
01056     if (face == NULL) {
01057         close(socks.recving);
01058         if (socks.sending != socks.recving)
01059             close(socks.sending); // XXX - could be problematic, but record_connection is unlikely to fail for other than ENOMEM
01060         return(NULL);
01061     }
01062     face->sendface = faceid_from_fd(h, socks.sending);
01063     ccnd_msg(h, "multicast on fd=%d id=%u, sending on face %u",
01064              face->recv_fd, face->faceid, face->sendface);
01065     return(face);
01066 }
01067 
01068 static void
01069 shutdown_client_fd(struct ccnd_handle *h, int fd)
01070 {
01071     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01072     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01073     struct face *face = NULL;
01074     unsigned faceid = CCN_NOFACEID;
01075     hashtb_start(h->faces_by_fd, e);
01076     if (hashtb_seek(e, &fd, sizeof(fd), 0) == HT_OLD_ENTRY) {
01077         face = e->data;
01078         if (face->recv_fd != fd) abort();
01079         faceid = face->faceid;
01080         if (faceid == CCN_NOFACEID) {
01081             ccnd_msg(h, "error indication on fd %d ignored", fd);
01082             hashtb_end(e);
01083             return;
01084         }
01085         close(fd);
01086         face->recv_fd = -1;
01087         ccnd_msg(h, "shutdown client fd=%d id=%u", fd, faceid);
01088         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->inbuf);
01089         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&face->outbuf);
01090         face = NULL;
01091     }
01092     hashtb_delete(e);
01093     hashtb_end(e);
01094     check_comm_file(h);
01095     reap_needed(h, 250000);
01096 }
01097 
01098 static void
01099 send_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face, struct content_entry *content)
01100 {
01101     struct ccn_charbuf *c = charbuf_obtain(h);
01102     int n, a, b, size;
01103     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
01104         return;
01105     size = content->size;
01106     if (h->debug & 4)
01107         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_to", face,
01108                         content->key, size);
01109     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LINK) != 0)
01110         ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_CCNProtocolDataUnit, CCN_DTAG);
01111     /* Excise the message-digest name component */
01112     n = content->ncomps;
01113     if (n < 2) abort();
01114     a = content->comps[n - 2];
01115     b = content->comps[n - 1];
01116     if (b - a != 36)
01117         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "strange_digest", face, content->key, size);
01118     ccn_charbuf_append(c, content->key, a);
01119     ccn_charbuf_append(c, content->key + b, size - b);
01120     ccn_stuff_interest(h, face, c);
01121     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LINK) != 0)
01122         ccn_charbuf_append_closer(c);
01123     ccnd_send(h, face, c->buf, c->length);
01124     h->content_items_sent += 1;
01125     charbuf_release(h, c);
01126 }
01127 
01128 static enum cq_delay_class
01129 choose_content_delay_class(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid, int content_flags)
01130 {
01131     struct face *face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
01132     if (face == NULL)
01133         return(CCN_CQ_ASAP); /* Going nowhere, get it over with */
01134     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_LINK | CCN_FACE_MCAST)) != 0) /* udplink or such, delay more */
01135         return((content_flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_SLOWSEND) ? CCN_CQ_SLOW : CCN_CQ_NORMAL);
01136     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_DGRAM) != 0)
01137         return(CCN_CQ_NORMAL); /* udp, delay just a little */
01138     if ((face->flags & (CCN_FACE_GG | CCN_FACE_LOCAL)) != 0)
01139         return(CCN_CQ_ASAP); /* localhost, answer quickly */
01140     return(CCN_CQ_NORMAL); /* default */
01141 }
01142 
01143 static unsigned
01144 randomize_content_delay(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_queue *q)
01145 {
01146     unsigned usec;
01147     
01148     usec = q->min_usec + q->rand_usec;
01149     if (usec < 2)
01150         return(1);
01151     if (usec <= 20 || q->rand_usec < 2) // XXX - what is a good value for this?
01152         return(usec); /* small value, don't bother to randomize */
01153     usec = q->min_usec + (nrand48(h->seed) % q->rand_usec);
01154     if (usec < 2)
01155         return(1);
01156     return(usec);
01157 }
01158 
01159 static int
01160 content_sender(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01161     void *clienth,
01162     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01163     int flags)
01164 {
01165     int i, j;
01166     int delay;
01167     int nsec;
01168     int burst_nsec;
01169     int burst_max;
01170     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
01171     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01172     unsigned faceid = ev->evint;
01173     struct face *face = NULL;
01174     struct content_queue *q = ev->evdata;
01175     (void)sched;
01176     
01177     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0)
01178         goto Bail;
01179     face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
01180     if (face == NULL)
01181         goto Bail;
01182     if (q->send_queue == NULL)
01183         goto Bail;
01184     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
01185         goto Bail;
01186     /* Send the content at the head of the queue */
01187     if (q->ready > q->send_queue->n ||
01188         (q->ready == 0 && q->nrun >= 12 && q->nrun < 120))
01189         q->ready = q->send_queue->n;
01190     nsec = 0;
01191     burst_nsec = q->burst_nsec;
01192     burst_max = 2;
01193     if (q->ready < burst_max)
01194         burst_max = q->ready;
01195     if (burst_max == 0)
01196         q->nrun = 0;
01197     for (i = 0; i < burst_max && nsec < 1000000; i++) {
01198         content = content_from_accession(h, q->send_queue->buf[i]);
01199         if (content == NULL)
01200             q->nrun = 0;
01201         else {
01202             send_content(h, face, content);
01203             /* face may have vanished, bail out if it did */
01204             if (face_from_faceid(h, faceid) == NULL)
01205                 goto Bail;
01206             nsec += burst_nsec * (unsigned)((content->size + 1023) / 1024);
01207             q->nrun++;
01208         }
01209     }
01210     if (q->ready < i) abort();
01211     q->ready -= i;
01212     /* Update queue */
01213     for (j = 0; i < q->send_queue->n; i++, j++)
01214         q->send_queue->buf[j] = q->send_queue->buf[i];
01215     q->send_queue->n = j;
01216     /* Do a poll before going on to allow others to preempt send. */
01217     delay = (nsec + 499) / 1000 + 1;
01218     if (q->ready > 0) {
01219         if (h->debug & 8)
01220             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u ready %u delay %i nrun %u",
01221                      faceid, q->ready, delay, q->nrun, face->surplus);
01222         return(delay);
01223     }
01224     q->ready = j;
01225     if (q->nrun >= 12 && q->nrun < 120) {
01226         /* We seem to be a preferred provider, forgo the randomized delay */
01227         if (j == 0)
01228             delay += burst_nsec / 50;
01229         if (h->debug & 8)
01230             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u ready %u delay %i nrun %u surplus %u",
01231                     (unsigned)ev->evint, q->ready, delay, q->nrun, face->surplus);
01232         return(delay);
01233     }
01234     /* Determine when to run again */
01235     for (i = 0; i < q->send_queue->n; i++) {
01236         content = content_from_accession(h, q->send_queue->buf[i]);
01237         if (content != NULL) {
01238             q->nrun = 0;
01239             delay = randomize_content_delay(h, q);
01240             if (h->debug & 8)
01241                 ccnd_msg(h, "face %u queued %u delay %i",
01242                          (unsigned)ev->evint, q->ready, delay);
01243             return(delay);
01244         }
01245     }
01246     q->send_queue->n = q->ready = 0;
01247 Bail:
01248     q->sender = NULL;
01249     return(0);
01250 }
01251 
01252 static int
01253 face_send_queue_insert(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01254                        struct face *face, struct content_entry *content)
01255 {
01256     int ans;
01257     int delay;
01258     enum cq_delay_class c;
01259     enum cq_delay_class k;
01260     struct content_queue *q;
01261     if (face == NULL || content == NULL || (face->flags & CCN_FACE_NOSEND) != 0)
01262         return(-1);
01263     c = choose_content_delay_class(h, face->faceid, content->flags);
01264     if (face->q[c] == NULL)
01265         face->q[c] = content_queue_create(h, face, c);
01266     q = face->q[c];
01267     if (q == NULL)
01268         return(-1);
01269     /* Check the other queues first, it might be in one of them */
01270     for (k = 0; k < CCN_CQ_N; k++) {
01271         if (k != c && face->q[k] != NULL) {
01272             ans = ccn_indexbuf_member(face->q[k]->send_queue, content->accession);
01273             if (ans >= 0) {
01274                 if (h->debug & 8)
01275                     ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "content_otherq", face,
01276                                     content->key, content->size);
01277                 return(ans);
01278             }
01279         }
01280     }
01281     ans = ccn_indexbuf_set_insert(q->send_queue, content->accession);
01282     if (q->sender == NULL) {
01283         delay = randomize_content_delay(h, q);
01284         q->ready = q->send_queue->n;
01285         q->sender = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, delay,
01286                                        content_sender, q, face->faceid);
01287         if (h->debug & 8)
01288             ccnd_msg(h, "face %u q %d delay %d usec", face->faceid, c, delay);
01289     }
01290     return (ans);
01291 }
01292 
01293 /**
01294  * If the pe interest is slated to be sent to the given faceid,
01295  * promote the faceid to the front of the list, preserving the order
01296  * of the others.
01297  * @returns -1 if not found, or pe->sent if successful.
01298  */
01299 static int
01300 promote_outbound(struct propagating_entry *pe, unsigned faceid)
01301 {
01302     struct ccn_indexbuf *ob = pe->outbound;
01303     int lb = pe->sent;
01304     int i;
01305     if (ob == NULL || ob->n <= lb || lb < 0)
01306         return(-1);
01307     for (i = ob->n - 1; i >= lb; i--)
01308         if (ob->buf[i] == faceid)
01309             break;
01310     if (i < lb)
01311         return(-1);
01312     for (; i > lb; i--)
01313         ob->buf[i] = ob->buf[i-1];
01314     ob->buf[lb] = faceid;
01315     return(lb);
01316 }
01317 
01318 /**
01319  * Consume matching interests
01320  * given a nameprefix_entry and a piece of content.
01321  *
01322  * If face is not NULL, pay attention only to interests from that face.
01323  * It is allowed to pass NULL for pc, but if you have a (valid) one it
01324  * will avoid a re-parse.
01325  * @returns number of matches found.
01326  */
01327 static int
01328 consume_matching_interests(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01329                            struct nameprefix_entry *npe,
01330                            struct content_entry *content,
01331                            struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pc,
01332                            struct face *face)
01333 {
01334     int matches = 0;
01335     struct propagating_entry *head;
01336     struct propagating_entry *next;
01337     struct propagating_entry *p;
01338     const unsigned char *content_msg;
01339     size_t content_size;
01340     struct face *f;
01341     
01342     head = &npe->pe_head;
01343     content_msg = content->key;
01344     content_size = content->size;
01345     f = face;
01346     for (p = head->next; p != head; p = next) {
01347         next = p->next;
01348         if (p->interest_msg != NULL &&
01349             ((face == NULL && (f = face_from_faceid(h, p->faceid)) != NULL) ||
01350              (face != NULL && p->faceid == face->faceid))) {
01351             if (ccn_content_matches_interest(content_msg, content_size, 0, pc,
01352                                              p->interest_msg, p->size, NULL)) {
01353                 face_send_queue_insert(h, f, content);
01354                 if (h->debug & (32 | 8))
01355                     ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "consume", f,
01356                                     p->interest_msg, p->size);
01357                 matches += 1;
01358                 consume(h, p);
01359             }
01360         }
01361     }
01362     return(matches);
01363 }
01364 
01365 static void
01366 adjust_npe_predicted_response(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01367                               struct nameprefix_entry *npe, int up)
01368 {
01369     unsigned t = npe->usec;
01370     if (up)
01371         t = t + (t >> 3);
01372     else
01373         t = t - (t >> 7);
01374     if (t < 127)
01375         t = 127;
01376     else if (t > 1000000)
01377         t = 1000000;
01378     npe->usec = t;
01379 }
01380 
01381 static void
01382 adjust_predicted_response(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01383                           struct propagating_entry *pe, int up)
01384 {
01385     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;
01386         
01387     npe = nameprefix_for_pe(h, pe);
01388     if (npe == NULL)
01389         return;
01390     adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe, up);
01391     if (npe->parent != NULL)
01392         adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe->parent, up);
01393 }
01394 
01395 /**
01396  * Keep a little history about where matching content comes from.
01397  */
01398 static void
01399 note_content_from(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01400                   struct nameprefix_entry *npe,
01401                   unsigned from_faceid,
01402                   int prefix_comps)
01403 {
01404     if (npe->src == from_faceid)
01405         adjust_npe_predicted_response(h, npe, 0);
01406     else if (npe->src == CCN_NOFACEID)
01407         npe->src = from_faceid;
01408     else {
01409         npe->osrc = npe->src;
01410         npe->src = from_faceid;
01411     }
01412     if (h->debug & 8)
01413         ccnd_msg(h, "sl.%d %u ci=%d osrc=%u src=%u usec=%d", __LINE__,
01414                  from_faceid, prefix_comps, npe->osrc, npe->src, npe->usec);
01415 }
01416 
01417 /**
01418  * Use the history to reorder the interest forwarding.
01419  *
01420  * @returns number of tap faces that are present.
01421  */
01422 static int
01423 reorder_outbound_using_history(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01424                                struct nameprefix_entry *npe,
01425                                struct propagating_entry *pe)
01426 {
01427     int ntap = 0;
01428     int i;
01429     
01430     if (npe->osrc != CCN_NOFACEID)
01431         promote_outbound(pe, npe->osrc);
01432     /* Process npe->src last so it will be tried first */
01433     if (npe->src != CCN_NOFACEID)
01434         promote_outbound(pe, npe->src);
01435     /* Tap are really first. */
01436     if (npe->tap != NULL) {
01437         ntap = npe->tap->n;
01438         for (i = 0; i < ntap; i++)
01439             promote_outbound(pe, npe->tap->buf[i]);
01440     }
01441     return(ntap);
01442 }
01443 
01444 /**
01445  * Find and consume interests that match given content.
01446  *
01447  * Schedules the sending of the content.
01448  * If face is not NULL, pay attention only to interests from that face.
01449  * It is allowed to pass NULL for pc, but if you have a (valid) one it
01450  * will avoid a re-parse.
01451  * For new content, from_face is the source; for old content, from_face is NULL.
01452  * @returns number of matches, or -1 if the new content should be dropped.
01453  */
01454 static int
01455 match_interests(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content,
01456                            struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pc,
01457                            struct face *face, struct face *from_face)
01458 {
01459     int n_matched = 0;
01460     int new_matches;
01461     int ci;
01462     int cm = 0;
01463     unsigned c0 = content->comps[0];
01464     const unsigned char *key = content->key + c0;
01465     struct nameprefix_entry *npe = NULL;
01466     for (ci = content->ncomps - 1; ci >= 0; ci--) {
01467         int size = content->comps[ci] - c0;
01468         npe = hashtb_lookup(h->nameprefix_tab, key, size);
01469         if (npe != NULL)
01470             break;
01471     }
01472     for (; npe != NULL; npe = npe->parent, ci--) {
01473         if (npe->fgen != h->forward_to_gen)
01474             update_forward_to(h, npe);
01475         if (from_face != NULL && (npe->flags & CCN_FORW_LOCAL) != 0 &&
01476             (from_face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) == 0)
01477             return(-1);
01478         new_matches = consume_matching_interests(h, npe, content, pc, face);
01479         if (from_face != NULL && (new_matches != 0 || ci + 1 == cm))
01480             note_content_from(h, npe, from_face->faceid, ci);
01481         if (new_matches != 0) {
01482             cm = ci; /* update stats for this prefix and one shorter */
01483             n_matched += new_matches;
01484         }
01485     }
01486     return(n_matched);
01487 }
01488 
01489 /**
01490  * Send a message in a PDU, possibly stuffing other interest messages into it.
01491  */
01492 static void
01493 stuff_and_send(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face,
01494              unsigned char *data, size_t size) {
01495     struct ccn_charbuf *c = NULL;
01496     
01497     if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_LINK) != 0) {
01498         c = charbuf_obtain(h);
01499         ccn_charbuf_reserve(c, size + 5);
01500         ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_CCNProtocolDataUnit, CCN_DTAG);
01501         ccn_charbuf_append(c, data, size);
01502         ccn_stuff_interest(h, face, c);
01503         ccn_charbuf_append_closer(c);
01504     }
01505     else if (h->mtu > size) {
01506          c = charbuf_obtain(h);
01507          ccn_charbuf_append(c, data, size);
01508          ccn_stuff_interest(h, face, c);
01509     }
01510     else {
01511         /* avoid a copy in this case */
01512         ccnd_send(h, face, data, size);
01513         return;
01514     }
01515     ccnd_send(h, face, c->buf, c->length);
01516     charbuf_release(h, c);
01517     return;
01518 }
01519 
01520 /**
01521  * Stuff a PDU with interest messages that will fit.
01522  *
01523  * Note by default stuffing does not happen due to the setting of h->mtu.
01524  * @returns the number of messages that were stuffed.
01525  */
01526 static int
01527 ccn_stuff_interest(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01528                    struct face *face, struct ccn_charbuf *c)
01529 {
01530     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01531     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01532     int n_stuffed = 0;
01533     int remaining_space = h->mtu - c->length;
01534     if (remaining_space < 20 || face == h->face0)
01535         return(0);
01536     for (hashtb_start(h->nameprefix_tab, e);
01537          remaining_space >= 20 && e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01538         struct nameprefix_entry *npe = e->data;
01539         struct propagating_entry *head = &npe->pe_head;
01540         struct propagating_entry *p;
01541         for (p = head->prev; p != head; p = p->prev) {
01542             if (p->outbound != NULL &&
01543                 p->outbound->n > p->sent &&
01544                 p->size <= remaining_space &&
01545                 p->interest_msg != NULL &&
01546                 ((p->flags & (CCN_PR_STUFFED1 | CCN_PR_WAIT1)) == 0) &&
01547                 ((p->flags & CCN_PR_UNSENT) == 0 ||
01548                  p->outbound->buf[p->sent] == face->faceid) &&
01549                 promote_outbound(p, face->faceid) != -1) {
01550                 remaining_space -= p->size;
01551                 if ((p->flags & CCN_PR_UNSENT) != 0) {
01552                     p->flags &= ~CCN_PR_UNSENT;
01553                     p->flags |= CCN_PR_STUFFED1;
01554                 }
01555                 p->sent++;
01556                 n_stuffed++;
01557                 ccn_charbuf_append(c, p->interest_msg, p->size);
01558                 h->interests_stuffed++;
01559                 if (h->debug & 2)
01560                     ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "stuff_interest_to", face,
01561                                     p->interest_msg, p->size);
01562                 /*
01563                  * Don't stuff multiple interests with same prefix
01564                  * to avoid subverting attempts at redundancy.
01565                  */
01566                 break;
01567             }
01568         }
01569     }
01570     hashtb_end(e);
01571     return(n_stuffed);
01572 }
01573 
01574 /**
01575  * Checks for inactivity on datagram faces.
01576  * @returns number of faces that have gone away.
01577  */
01578 static int
01579 check_dgram_faces(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01580 {
01581     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01582     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01583     int count = 0;
01584     int checkflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_PERMANENT;
01585     int wantflags = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
01586     
01587     hashtb_start(h->dgram_faces, e);
01588     while (e->data != NULL) {
01589         struct face *face = e->data;
01590         if (face->addr != NULL && (face->flags & checkflags) == wantflags) {
01591             if (face->recvcount == 0) {
01592                 count += 1;
01593                 hashtb_delete(e);
01594                 continue;
01595             }
01596             face->recvcount = (face->recvcount > 1); /* go around twice */
01597         }
01598         hashtb_next(e);
01599     }
01600     hashtb_end(e);
01601     return(count);
01602 }
01603 
01604 /**
01605  * Destroys the face identified by faceid.
01606  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for failure.
01607  */
01608 int
01609 ccnd_destroy_face(struct ccnd_handle *h, unsigned faceid)
01610 {
01611     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01612     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01613     struct face *face;
01614     int dgram_chk = CCN_FACE_DGRAM | CCN_FACE_MCAST;
01615     int dgram_want = CCN_FACE_DGRAM;
01616     
01617     face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
01618     if (face == NULL)
01619         return(-1);
01620     if ((face->flags & dgram_chk) == dgram_want) {
01621         hashtb_start(h->dgram_faces, e);
01622         hashtb_seek(e, face->addr, face->addrlen, 0);
01623         if (e->data == face)
01624             face = NULL;
01625         hashtb_delete(e);
01626         hashtb_end(e);
01627         if (face == NULL)
01628             return(0);
01629     }
01630     shutdown_client_fd(h, face->recv_fd);
01631     face = NULL;
01632     return(0);
01633 }
01634 
01635 /**
01636  * Remove expired faces from npe->forward_to
01637  */
01638 static void
01639 check_forward_to(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct nameprefix_entry *npe)
01640 {
01641     struct ccn_indexbuf *ft = npe->forward_to;
01642     int i;
01643     int j;
01644     if (ft == NULL)
01645         return;
01646     for (i = 0; i < ft->n; i++)
01647         if (face_from_faceid(h, ft->buf[i]) == NULL)
01648             break;
01649     for (j = i + 1; j < ft->n; j++)
01650         if (face_from_faceid(h, ft->buf[j]) != NULL)
01651             ft->buf[i++] = ft->buf[j];
01652     if (i == 0)
01653         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&npe->forward_to);
01654     else if (i < ft->n)
01655         ft->n = i;
01656 }
01657 
01658 /**
01659  * Check for expired propagating interests.
01660  * @returns number that have gone away.
01661  */
01662 static int
01663 check_propagating(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01664 {
01665     int count = 0;
01666     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01667     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01668     struct propagating_entry *pe;
01669     
01670     hashtb_start(h->propagating_tab, e);
01671     for (pe = e->data; pe != NULL; pe = e->data) {
01672         if (pe->interest_msg == NULL) {
01673             if (pe->size == 0) {
01674                 count += 1;
01675                 hashtb_delete(e);
01676                 continue;
01677             }
01678             pe->size = (pe->size > 1); /* go around twice */
01679             /* XXX - could use a flag bit instead of hacking size */
01680         }
01681         hashtb_next(e);
01682     }
01683     hashtb_end(e);
01684     return(count);
01685 }
01686 
01687 /**
01688  * Ages src info and retires unused nameprefix entries.
01689  * @returns number that have gone away.
01690  */
01691 static int
01692 check_nameprefix_entries(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01693 {
01694     int count = 0;
01695     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01696     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01697     struct propagating_entry *head;
01698     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;    
01699     
01700     hashtb_start(h->nameprefix_tab, e);
01701     for (npe = e->data; npe != NULL; npe = e->data) {
01702         if (npe->forward_to != NULL)
01703             check_forward_to(h, npe);
01704         if (  npe->src == CCN_NOFACEID &&
01705               npe->children == 0 &&
01706               npe->forwarding == NULL) {
01707             head = &npe->pe_head;
01708             if (head == head->next) {
01709                 count += 1;
01710                 if (npe->parent != NULL) {
01711                     npe->parent->children--;
01712                     npe->parent = NULL;
01713                 }
01714                 hashtb_delete(e);
01715                 continue;
01716             }
01717         }
01718         npe->osrc = npe->src;
01719         npe->src = CCN_NOFACEID;
01720         hashtb_next(e);
01721     }
01722     hashtb_end(e);
01723     return(count);
01724 }
01725 
01726 static void
01727 check_comm_file(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01728 {
01729     if (!comm_file_ok()) {
01730         ccnd_msg(h, "stopping (%s gone)", unlink_this_at_exit);
01731         unlink_this_at_exit = NULL;
01732         h->running = 0;
01733     }
01734 }
01735 
01736 /**
01737  * Scheduled reap event for retiring expired structures.
01738  */
01739 static int
01740 reap(
01741     struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01742     void *clienth,
01743     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01744     int flags)
01745 {
01746     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
01747     (void)(sched);
01748     (void)(ev);
01749     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
01750         h->reaper = NULL;
01751         return(0);
01752     }
01753     check_dgram_faces(h);
01754     check_propagating(h);
01755     check_nameprefix_entries(h);
01756     check_comm_file(h);
01757     return(2 * CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_MICROSEC);
01758 }
01759 
01760 static void
01761 reap_needed(struct ccnd_handle *h, int init_delay_usec)
01762 {
01763     if (h->reaper == NULL)
01764         h->reaper = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, init_delay_usec, reap, NULL, 0);
01765 }
01766 
01767 static int
01768 remove_content(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct content_entry *content)
01769 {
01770     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01771     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01772     int res;
01773     if (content == NULL)
01774         return(-1);
01775     hashtb_start(h->content_tab, e);
01776     res = hashtb_seek(e, content->key,
01777                       content->key_size, content->size - content->key_size);
01778     if (res != HT_OLD_ENTRY)
01779         abort();
01780     if ((content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0)
01781         h->n_stale--;
01782     if (h->debug & 4)
01783         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "remove", NULL,
01784                         content->key, content->size);
01785     hashtb_delete(e);
01786     hashtb_end(e);
01787     return(0);
01788 }
01789 
01790 /**
01791  * Periodic content cleaning
01792  */
01793 static int
01794 clean_deamon(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01795              void *clienth,
01796              struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01797              int flags)
01798 {
01799     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
01800     (void)(sched);
01801     (void)(ev);
01802     unsigned long n;
01803     ccn_accession_t limit;
01804     ccn_accession_t a;
01805     ccn_accession_t min_stale;
01806     int check_limit = 500;  /* Do not run for too long at once */
01807     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
01808     int res = 0;
01809     int ignore;
01810     int i;
01811     
01812     /*
01813      * If we ran into our processing limit (check_limit) last time,
01814      * ev->evint tells us where to restart.
01815      */
01816     
01817     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
01818         h->clean = NULL;
01819         return(0);
01820     }
01821     n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
01822     if (n <= h->capacity)
01823         return(15000000);
01824     /* Toss unsolicited content first */
01825     for (i = 0; i < h->unsol->n; i++) {
01826         if (i == check_limit) {
01827             for (i = check_limit; i < h->unsol->n; i++)
01828                 h->unsol->buf[i-check_limit] = h->unsol->buf[i];
01829             h->unsol->n -= check_limit;
01830             return(500);
01831         }
01832         a = h->unsol->buf[i];
01833         content = content_from_accession(h, a);
01834         if (content != NULL &&
01835             (content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_PRECIOUS) == 0)
01836             remove_content(h, content);
01837     }
01838     n = hashtb_n(h->content_tab);
01839     h->unsol->n = 0;
01840     if (h->min_stale <= h->max_stale) {
01841         /* clean out stale content next */
01842         limit = h->max_stale;
01843         if (limit > h->accession)
01844             limit = h->accession;
01845         min_stale = ~0;
01846         a = ev->evint;
01847         if (a <= h->min_stale || a > h->max_stale)
01848             a = h->min_stale;
01849         else
01850             min_stale = h->min_stale;
01851         for (; a <= limit && n > h->capacity; a++) {
01852             if (check_limit-- <= 0) {
01853                 ev->evint = a;
01854                 break;
01855             }
01856             content = content_from_accession(h, a);
01857             if (content != NULL &&
01858                   (content->flags & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE) != 0) {
01859                 res = remove_content(h, content);
01860                 if (res < 0) {
01861                     if (a < min_stale)
01862                         min_stale = a;
01863                 }
01864                 else {
01865                     content = NULL;
01866                     n -= 1;
01867                 }
01868             }
01869         }
01870         if (min_stale < a)
01871             h->min_stale = min_stale;
01872         else if (a > limit) {
01873             h->min_stale = ~0;
01874             h->max_stale = 0;
01875         }
01876         else
01877             h->min_stale = a;
01878         if (check_limit <= 0)
01879             return(5000);
01880     }
01881     else {
01882         /* Make oldish content stale, for cleanup on next round */
01883         limit = h->accession;
01884         ignore = CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE | CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_PRECIOUS;
01885         for (a = h->accession_base; a <= limit && n > h->capacity; a++) {
01886             content = content_from_accession(h, a);
01887             if (content != NULL && (content->flags & ignore) == 0) {
01888                 mark_stale(h, content);
01889                 n--;
01890             }
01891         }
01892         ev->evint = 0;
01893         return(1000000);
01894     }
01895     ev->evint = 0;
01896     return(15000000);
01897 }
01898 
01899 static void
01900 clean_needed(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01901 {
01902     if (h->clean == NULL)
01903         h->clean = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched, 1000000, clean_deamon, NULL, 0);
01904 }
01905 
01906 /**
01907  * Age out the old forwarding table entries
01908  */
01909 static int
01910 age_forwarding(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
01911              void *clienth,
01912              struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
01913              int flags)
01914 {
01915     struct ccnd_handle *h = clienth;
01916     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01917     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01918     struct ccn_forwarding *f;
01919     struct ccn_forwarding *next;
01920     struct ccn_forwarding **p;
01921     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;
01922     
01923     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
01924         h->age_forwarding = NULL;
01925         return(0);
01926     }
01927     hashtb_start(h->nameprefix_tab, e);
01928     for (npe = e->data; npe != NULL; npe = e->data) {
01929         p = &npe->forwarding;
01930         for (f = npe->forwarding; f != NULL; f = next) {
01931             next = f->next;
01932             if ((f->flags & CCN_FORW_REFRESHED) == 0 ||
01933                   face_from_faceid(h, f->faceid) == NULL) {
01934                 if (h->debug & 2) {
01935                     struct face *face = face_from_faceid(h, f->faceid);
01936                     if (face != NULL) {
01937                         struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
01938                         ccn_name_init(prefix);
01939                         ccn_name_append_components(prefix, e->key, 0, e->keysize);
01940                         ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__, "prefix_expiry", face,
01941                                 prefix->buf,
01942                                 prefix->length);
01943                         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefix);
01944                     }
01945                 }
01946                 *p = next;
01947                 free(f);
01948                 f = NULL;
01949                 continue;
01950             }
01951             f->expires -= CCN_FWU_SECS;
01952             if (f->expires <= 0)
01953                 f->flags &= ~CCN_FORW_REFRESHED;
01954             p = &(f->next);
01955         }
01956         hashtb_next(e);
01957     }
01958     hashtb_end(e);
01959     h->forward_to_gen += 1;
01960     return(CCN_FWU_SECS*1000000);
01961 }
01962 
01963 static void
01964 age_forwarding_needed(struct ccnd_handle *h)
01965 {
01966     if (h->age_forwarding == NULL)
01967         h->age_forwarding = ccn_schedule_event(h->sched,
01968                                                CCN_FWU_SECS*1000000,
01969                                                age_forwarding,
01970                                                NULL, 0);
01971 }
01972 
01973 static struct ccn_forwarding *
01974 seek_forwarding(struct ccnd_handle *h,
01975                 struct nameprefix_entry *npe, unsigned faceid)
01976 {
01977     struct ccn_forwarding *f;
01978     
01979     for (f = npe->forwarding; f != NULL; f = f->next)
01980         if (f->faceid == faceid)
01981             return(f);
01982     f = calloc(1, sizeof(*f));
01983     if (f != NULL) {
01984         f->faceid = faceid;
01985         f->flags = (CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT | CCN_FORW_ACTIVE);
01986         f->expires = 0x7FFFFFFF;
01987         f->next = npe->forwarding;
01988         npe->forwarding = f;
01989     }
01990     return(f);
01991 }
01992 
01993 /**
01994  * Register or update a prefix in the forwarding table (FIB).
01995  *
01996  * @param h is the ccnd handle.
01997  * @param msg is a ccnb-encoded message containing the name prefix somewhere.
01998  * @param comps contains the delimiting offsets for the name components in msg.
01999  * @param ncomps is the number of relevant components.
02000  * @param faceid indicates which face to forward to.
02001  * @param flags are the forwarding entry flags (CCN_FORW_...), -1 for defaults.
02002  * @param expires tells the remaining lifetime, in seconds.
02003  * @returns -1 for error, or new flags upon success; the private flag
02004  *        CCN_FORW_REFRESHED indicates a previously existing entry.
02005  */
02006 static int
02007 ccnd_reg_prefix(struct ccnd_handle *h,
02008                 const unsigned char *msg,
02009                 struct ccn_indexbuf *comps,
02010                 int ncomps,
02011                 unsigned faceid,
02012                 int flags,
02013                 int expires)
02014 {
02015     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
02016     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
02017     struct ccn_forwarding *f = NULL;
02018     struct nameprefix_entry *npe = NULL;
02019     int res;
02020     struct face *face = NULL;
02021     
02022     if (flags >= 0 &&
02023         (flags & CCN_FORW_PUBMASK) != flags)
02024         return(-1);
02025     face = face_from_faceid(h, faceid);
02026     if (face == NULL)
02027         return(-1);
02028     /* This is a bit hacky, but it gives us a way to set CCN_FACE_DC */
02029     if (flags >= 0 && (flags & CCN_FORW_LAST) != 0) {
02030         face->flags |= CCN_FACE_DC;
02031         if ((face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) != 0) {
02032             face->flags &= ~CCN_FACE_GG;
02033             face->flags |= CCN_FACE_REGOK;
02034         }
02035     }
02036     hashtb_start(h->nameprefix_tab, e);
02037     res = nameprefix_seek(h, e, msg, comps, ncomps);
02038     if (res >= 0) {
02039         res = (res == HT_OLD_ENTRY) ? CCN_FORW_REFRESHED : 0;
02040         npe = e->data;
02041         f = seek_forwarding(h, npe, faceid);
02042         if (f != NULL) {
02043             h->forward_to_gen += 1; // XXX - too conservative, should check changes
02044             f->expires = expires;
02045             if (flags < 0)
02046                 flags = f->flags & CCN_FORW_PUBMASK;
02047             f->flags = (CCN_FORW_REFRESHED | flags);
02048             res |= flags;
02049             if (h->debug & (2 | 4)) {
02050                 struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
02051                 struct ccn_charbuf *debugtag = ccn_charbuf_create();
02052                 ccn_charbuf_putf(debugtag, "prefix,ff=%s%x",
02053                                  flags > 9 ? "0x" : "", flags);
02054                 if (f->expires < (1 << 30))
02055                     ccn_charbuf_putf(debugtag, ",sec=%d", expires);
02056                 ccn_name_init(prefix);
02057                 ccn_name_append_components(prefix, msg,
02058                                            comps->buf[0], comps->buf[ncomps]);
02059                 ccnd_debug_ccnb(h, __LINE__,
02060                                 ccn_charbuf_as_string(debugtag),
02061                                 face,
02062                                 prefix->buf,
02063                                 prefix->length);
02064                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefix);
02065                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&debugtag);
02066             }
02067         }
02068         else
02069             res = -1;
02070     }
02071     hashtb_end(e);
02072     return(res);
02073 }
02074 
02075 /**
02076  * Register a prefix, expressed in the form of a URI.
02077  * @returns negative value for error, or new face flags for success.
02078  */
02079 int
02080 ccnd_reg_uri(struct ccnd_handle *h,
02081              const char *uri,
02082              unsigned faceid,
02083              int flags,
02084              int expires)
02085 {
02086     struct ccn_charbuf *name;
02087     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
02088     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
02089     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps;
02090     int res;
02091     
02092     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
02093     ccn_name_init(name);
02094     res = ccn_name_from_uri(name, uri);
02095     if (res < 0)
02096         goto Bail;
02097     comps = ccn_indexbuf_create();
02098     d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, name->buf, name->length);
02099     res = ccn_parse_Name(d, comps);
02100     if (res < 0)
02101         goto Bail;
02102     res = ccnd_reg_prefix(h, name->buf, comps, comps->n - 1,
02103                           faceid, flags, expires);
02104 Bail:
02105     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
02106     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&comps);
02107     return(res);
02108 }
02109 
02110 /**
02111  * Register prefixes, expressed in the form of a list of URIs.
02112  * The URIs in the charbuf are each terminated by nul.
02113  */
02114 void
02115 ccnd_reg_uri_list(struct ccnd_handle *h,
02116              struct ccn_charbuf *uris,
02117              unsigned faceid,
02118              int flags,
02119              int expires)
02120 {
02121     size_t i;
02122     const char *s;
02123     s = ccn_charbuf_as_string(uris);
02124     for (i = 0; i + 1 < uris->length; i += strlen(s + i) + 1)
02125         ccnd_reg_uri(h, s + i, faceid, flags, expires);
02126 }
02127 
02128 /**
02129  * Called when a face is first created, and (perhaps) a second time in the case
02130  * that a face transitions from the undecided state.
02131  */
02132 static void
02133 register_new_face(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct face *face)
02134 {
02135     if (face->faceid != 0 && (face->flags & (CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED | CCN_FACE_PASSIVE)) == 0) {
02136         ccnd_face_status_change(h, face->faceid);
02137         if (h->flood && h->autoreg != NULL && (face->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) == 0)
02138             ccnd_reg_uri_list(h, h->autoreg, face->faceid,
02139                          CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT | CCN_FORW_ACTIVE,
02140                          0x7FFFFFFF);
02141     }
02142 }
02143 
02144 /**
02145  * @brief Process a newface request for the ccnd internal client.
02146  * @param h is the ccnd handle
02147  * @param msg points to a ccnd-encoded ContentObject containing a FaceInstance
02148             in its Content.
02149  * @param size is its size in bytes
02150  * @result on success the returned charbuf holds a new ccnd-encoded
02151  *         FaceInstance including faceid;
02152  *         returns NULL for any error.
02153  *
02154  * Is is permitted for the face to already exist.
02155  * A newly created face will have no registered prefixes, and so will not
02156  * receive any traffic.
02157  */
02158 struct ccn_charbuf *
02159 ccnd_req_newface(struct ccnd_handle *h, const unsigned char *msg, size_t size)
02160 {
02161     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pco = {0};
02162     int res;
02163     const unsigned char *req;
02164     size_t req_size;
02165     struct ccn_charbuf *result = NULL;
02166     struct ccn_face_instance *face_instance = NULL;
02167     struct addrinfo hints = {0};
02168     struct addrinfo *addrinfo = NULL;
02169     int fd = -1;
02170     int mcast;
02171     struct face *face = NULL;
02172     struct face *reqface = NULL;
02173     struct face *newface = NULL;
02174     int save;
02175 
02176     save = h->flood;
02177     h->flood = 0; /* never auto-register ccnx:/ for these */
02178     res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(msg, size, &pco, NULL);
02179     if (res < 0)
02180         goto Finish;        
02181     res = ccn_content_get_value(msg, size, &pco, &req, &req_size);
02182     if (res < 0)
02183         goto Finish;
02184     face_instance = ccn_face_instance_parse(req, req_size);
02185     if (face_instance == NULL || face_instance->action == NULL)
02186         goto Finish;
02187 
02188     if (strcmp(face_instance->action, "newface") != 0)
02189         goto Finish;
02190     if (face_instance->ccnd_id_size == sizeof(h->ccnd_id)) {
02191         if (memcmp(face_instance->ccnd_id, h->ccnd_id, sizeof(h->ccnd_id)) != 0)
02192             goto Finish;
02193     }
02194     else if (face_instance->ccnd_id_size |= 0)
02195         goto Finish;
02196     if (face_instance->descr.ipproto != IPPROTO_UDP &&
02197         face_instance->descr.ipproto != IPPROTO_TCP)
02198         goto Finish;
02199     if (face_instance->descr.address == NULL)
02200         goto Finish;
02201     if (face_instance->descr.port == NULL)
02202         goto Finish;
02203     /* consider the source ... */
02204     reqface = face_from_faceid(h, h->interest_faceid);
02205     if (reqface == NULL || (reqface->flags & CCN_FACE_GG) == 0)
02206         goto Finish;
02207     hints.ai_flags |= AI_NUMERICHOST;
02208     hints.ai_protocol = face_instance->descr.ipproto;
02209     hints.ai_socktype = (hints.ai_protocol == IPPROTO_UDP) ? SOCK_DGRAM : SOCK_STREAM;
02210     res = getaddrinfo(face_instance->descr.address,
02211                       face_instance->descr.port,
02212                       &hints,
02213                       &addrinfo);
02214     if (res != 0 || (h->debug & 128) != 0)
02215         ccnd_msg(h, "ccnd_req_newface from %u: getaddrinfo(%s, %s, ...) returned %d",
02216                  h->interest_faceid,
02217                  face_instance->descr.address,
02218                  face_instance->descr.port,
02219                  res);
02220     if (res != 0 || addrinfo == NULL)
02221         goto Finish;
02222     if (addrinfo->ai_next != NULL)
02223         ccnd_msg(h, "ccnd_req_newface: (addrinfo->ai_next != NULL) ? ?");
02224     if (face_instance->descr.ipproto == IPPROTO_UDP) {
02225         fd = -1;
02226         mcast = 0;
02227         if (addrinfo->ai_family == AF_INET) {
02228             face = face_from_faceid(h, h->ipv4_faceid);
02229             mcast = IN_MULTICAST(ntohl(((struct sockaddr_in *)(addrinfo->ai_addr))->sin_addr.s_addr));
02230         }
02231         else if (addrinfo->ai_family == AF_INET6) {
02232             face = face_from_faceid(h, h->ipv6_faceid);
02233             mcast = IN6_IS_ADDR_MULTICAST(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)addrinfo->ai_addr)->sin6_addr);
02234         }
02235         if (mcast)
02236             face = setup_multicast(h, face_instance,
02237                                    addrinfo->ai_addr,
02238                                    addrinfo->ai_addrlen);
02239         if (face == NULL)
02240             goto Finish;
02241         newface = get_dgram_source(h, face,
02242                                    addrinfo->ai_addr,
02243                                    addrinfo->ai_addrlen,
02244                                    0);
02245     }
02246     else if (addrinfo->ai_socktype == SOCK_STREAM) {
02247         newface = make_connection(h,
